title: Several Reported Killed Amid Widening Protests In Iran Over Economic Crisis | 10 News
description: Nationwide protests have entered a fifth day in Iran amid reports of deadly clashes between protesters and security forces over the soaring cost of living spreading to more parts of the country.  The demonstrations were initially sparked by the collapse of the national currency, with protests beginning on Sunday in the capital of Tehran.  Local media have reported at least six people were killed and 17 others were injured.  Iranian President Masoud Pezeshkian said, “We are engaged in a full-scale war. Right now, the enemy has placed most of its hopes on weakening us through economic pressure." title: Zohran Mamdani Sworn In As NYC Mayor, Promises ‘New Era’ For New York City | 10 News
description: Democrat Zohran Mamdani was sworn in as New York City's mayor on Thursday, January 1, after he was elected last November. "My fellow New Yorkers, today begins a new era. I stand before you, moved by the privilege of taking this sacred oath, humbled by the faith that you have placed in me," he said during his first speech as mayor. The 34-year-old, a member of the Democratic Party’s left-wing socialist faction, campaigned on cost-of-living issues, including universal childcare, affordable rents and free bus services. US Senator Bernie Sanders administered the oath of office during a public ceremony at City Hall, while Mamdani was privately sworn in earlier at the historic City Hall subway station. title: Up To 40 Dead In Crans-Montana Swiss Ski Resort Bar Fire, Australian Among Injured | 10 News
description: Up to 40 people are feared dead and around 115 injured after a fire ripped through a packed New Year’s Eve celebration at a bar in the Swiss ski resort of Crans-Montana.  Authorities say many of the victims were young people, with witnesses describing chaos as smoke filled the venue and patrons became trapped while trying to escape.  Survivors claim the blaze began when sparklers were waved near the bar’s wooden ceiling, triggering a sudden flashover that engulfed the room within moments.  Federal Minister Chris Bowen has confirmed one Australian was injured and is receiving medical treatment and consular support.  Swiss officials say the exact death toll is still being determined, with investigations continuing into the cause of one of the country’s worst fire tragedies. title: Three People Dead As Search Continues For Two Other Swimmers Missing Off NSW Coast | 10 News
description: Life Savers in New South Wales are pleading with beach goers to stick to patrolled beaches as the death toll from a horror few days climbs.  Three people have lost their lives, but it could be as many as five with searches for two missing people still underway. title: Two Killed, 12 Injured As 6.5 Magnitude Earthquake Strikes Mexico | 10 News
description: At least two people have been killed and several others injured after a powerful magnitude 6.5 earthquake struck southern and central Mexico.  The quake was centred near Acapulco in Guerrero state, with strong shaking and aftershocks felt across Mexico City.  Officials say a 50-year-old woman died in Guerrero and a 60-year-old man was killed in the capital, where at least 12 people were injured.  Residents and tourists rushed into the streets as authorities inspected damaged buildings and urged people to remain calm. title: Teen Killed In Melbourne Drive-By Shooting Outside Police Station | 10 News
description: A teen is dead and police are hunting for the gunman who killed him in a drive-by shooting in Melbourne, right out the front of a Police station.   An officer heard the shots and rushed to the scene, which became a cauldron of emotion as the victim's loved ones arrived and discovered the horror of what happened. title: Deadly Swiss Ski Resort Bar Fire Leaves Parents Searching For Missing Children | 10 News
description: As authorities gain a clearer picture of what sparked the blaze at a Swiss ski resort bar just hours into the New Year, they warn it will take much longer to identify the dozens of young people killed.  That has left parents desperately trying to find out whether their missing children are among the injured or the dead. title: Trump Issues Warning To Iran As Cost-Of-Living Protests Turn Deadly | 10 News
description: US President Donald Trump has issued a warning to Iran as cost-of-living protests in the country turn deadly.  He says the US is “locked and loaded” and ready to intervene if any more peaceful demonstrators are killed. title: Explosions Reported In Venezuelan Capital Caracas Amid Rising Tensions With United States | 10 News
description: #BREAKING: Explosions have been reported in Venezuela.  Videos show several fiery explosions in the nation’s capital, Caracas.  The extent of any injuries is unclear at this stage, with residents reporting low-flying aircraft in the area.  The blasts come amid escalating tensions between the country and the United States.
